channel.title: Latest Finextra Research Cards Headlines
channel.description: The Latest Financial IT Cards Headlines

item.title: Mastercard makes sustainable cards pledge
item.description: Mastercard is stepping up its sustainability efforts, vowing to ditch all first-use PVC plastics from its newly produced cards by the beginning of 2028.

item.title: Checkout.com moves into card issuing
item.description: Online payments firm Checkout.com is pushing into embedded finance with the addition of card issuing to its stack.

item.title: Judge upholds $5.6bn interchange settlement
item.description: A US federal appeals court has upheld a $5.6 billion antitrust class-action settlement between 12 million retailers and Visa and Mastercard over interchange fees.

item.title: Sparxpres partners Trifork and Tuum for card and financing platform
item.description: Danish financial institution Sparxpres has teamed up with core banking technology vendor Tuum and IT firm Trifork on a bespoke card and financing platform.

item.title: Card firms pause work on code for tracking firearm purchases
item.description: Visa, Mastercard, American Express and Discover have paused work on a new merchant category code for American gun merchants, citing pushback from Republican lawmakers.

item.title: Bank of Scotland introduces personalised gambling spend limits
item.description: Bank of Scotland is the latest UK lender to offer customers the ability to set a limit on how much they can spend each month on gambling using their debit card.

item.title: Mercedes-Benz drivers can now pay for services by onboard fingerprint sensor
item.description: Mercedes-Benz is introducing in-car fingerprint-based payments to drivers in Germany.

item.title: Bybit launches debit card; suspends US dollar deposits
item.description: Crypto Exchange Bybit has begun the roll out of Mastercard debit cards, enabling users to convert their crypto into fiat at the point of sale and ATMs.

item.title: Stripe forms issuer partnerships to help fight fraud
item.description: Stripe has launched an "enhanced issuer network": a set of partnerships with US card issuers designed to help businesses rescue fraud and boost authorisation rates.

item.title: Natwest waives customer charges for pocket money cards
item.description: Natwest customers can continue to enjoy free access to the bank's prepaid kids’ debit cards, as the lender scraps a proposed £1.99 per month subscription fee that was set to be imposed in May.

item.title: SBI Investment leads $28 million Series A in German fintech Pliant
item.description: Japan's SBI Investment has led a $28 million Series A round in Berlin-based corporate card platform, Pliant.

item.title: Barclays records surge in contactless transactions
item.description: The total value of all contactless payments jumped 49.7% in 2022, as Brits embraced the £100 transaction limit and returned to high street shopping following the easing of all coronavirus restrictions.

item.title: CardX adopts Mastercard Click to Pay
item.description: CardX, a Stax company and the leading surcharging compliance platform, has launched Mastercard Click to Pay on Lightbox, CardX’s online payment form, to expand the product’s reach.

item.title: Neo Financial launches debit card alternative
item.description: Neo Financial is excited to announce the launch of the Neo Money card. The Neo Money card puts more money in Canadians pockets, challenging the need for a traditional debit card.

item.title: Zenus Bank acquires Financial Urban Exchange
item.description: Zenus Bank, the digital bank that makes U.S. bank accounts available internationally, is proud to announce the acquisition of Financial Urban Exchange LLC (FUEX Payments), a fintech specializing in real-time payments for the Caribbean and Latin American (LAC) markets.

item.title: Wio Bank selects Paymentology for card issuing
item.description: Paymentology, the leading global issuer-processor, has joined forces with Wio Bank PJSC, the region’s first platform bank, to power its innovative banking model with customer-centric card payment services.

item.title: Askari Bank taps BPC for credit card and online fraud management system
item.description: Global payments fintech BPC today announced a technical partnership with Askari Bank in Pakistan.

item.title: GoHenry to issue WWF-approved wild card designs for eco-conscious kids
item.description: GoHenry, the prepaid debit card and financial education app for kids aged 6-18, has teamed up with environmental organisation the World Wide Fund for Nature (WWF) to launch a special range of Wild Card designs, with £1 from each card sale being donated to WWF and its huge efforts to protect animals and bring our world back to life.

item.title: AccesBanque migrates ATM acquiring and card management businesses to Compass Plus
item.description: AccesBanque Madagascar, part of AccesHolding Group and one of the largest commercial banks in the country, has successfully migrated its ATM acquiring and card management businesses to Compass Plus Technologies’ processing centre.

item.title: Centi issues Swiss franc stablecoin
item.description: Pioneering Swiss payment startup Centi announces the launch of its Swiss Franc pegged stablecoin, backed 1:1 by a Swiss bank, which will serve as the basis for Centi’s groundbreaking Global Payment Network.

item.title: Mastercard expands Engage partner network
item.description: The Mastercard Engage partner network helps connect customers with technology partners to build innovative guest checkout and point-of-sale solutions that deliver consumer choice

item.title: Qolo and PayQuicker team up
item.description: Qolo, the leading omnichannel payments and card issuing processor, today announced its partnership with PayQuicker, financial technology leader in the global payouts market, to provide unified disbursement services to PayQuicker and its clients.

item.title: Zeta partners Featurespace to deliver fraud detection to credit card issuers
item.description: Zeta, a next-gen credit card processor, and Featurespace, a world leader in enterprise fraud and financial crime prevention, today announced their partnership to bring to market a solution that combines best-in-class credit card processing and fraud detection for Issuers in the US.

item.title: Acquired.com selects MultiPay as hardware provider for payment terminals
item.description: Acquired.com, a UK payments specialist and payment initiation service provider, and MultiPay Global Solutions, a leading provider of payments technology, have today announced a new partnership that sees Acquired.com select MultiPay as the official hardware provider for its in-person payment card terminals.

item.title: Payments in a hyper-personalized world
item.description: Randy Kern, Chief Technology Officer, Marqeta joins FinextraTV at Money20/20 in Las Vegas, discussing how the expectations of customers are shifting in a hyper-personalized world, what innovations are being made in APIs, and how the nature of card payments are changing to meet the demands for quick, efficient and seamless payments.

item.title: Fiat Currency 2.0: Counter argument to the Cryptocurrency narrative
item.description: Tony McLaughlin, Emerging Payments & Business Development, Citi, speaks at Money 20/20 USA about the practical problems that still need addressing in the crypto-currency community, how Fiat Currency 2.0 will help fix payments as a counter balance to crypto and what challenges still exist around tokenisation and coins. We ask how this impacts the big techs and what regulatory, political and ethical concerns need to be addressed first before they achieve their own currencies.

item.title: Developer Day at FusionONE stirs excitement among the users
item.description: Finextra’s Hannah Wallace reports on day two of the FusionONE open banking developer conference to learn more about Finastra’s vision for the future of banking re-engineered upon APIs and open platforms. We gain exclusive insight from the developers into what's exciting them most about FusionFabric.cloud and how they are looking to innovate and create using the platform.

item.title: Encapsulating themes from the payments market
item.description: Marion King, Director of Payments, NatWest, speaks about her role and the responsibility it entails, including determining payments strategy for a major UK Bank, keeping NatWest's customers secure, regulation and innovation, what key themes we are seeing in the payments market and the developments to come.

item.title: Exploring new commerce: Mastercard's Sonic Signature
item.description: Raja Rajamannar, Chief Marketing & Communications Officer and President, Healthcare Business, Mastercard, speaks at Mobile World Congress about the unveiling of Mastercard's Sonic Brand, the thinking behind the new musical logo and how it was developed.

item.title: The Power of Partnerships: Trust, Data & Digital Identity
item.description: Ann Cairns, Vice Chair, Mastercard, speaks at Mobile World Congress 2019 about the importance of partnerships, Mastercard's partnership with Microsoft, how they are using data in medicine and towards social reform, and what impact neobanks are having on the industry.

item.title: Industry challenges around IBOR Transition
item.description: Andrew Kouloumbrides, CEO, Xceptor and Bruce Laing, Partner, IBOR Transition lead, Baringa, speaks about the industry challenges around IBOR Transition, what Financial Institutions have done up to date to meet these challenges and what to expect next.

item.title: The global adoption of real-time payments, sparking industry innovation
item.description: Paul Stoddart, Chief Executive Officer, Vocalink & Colleen Taylor, Executive Vice President, Mastercard, speak at Sibos 2018 in Sydney about recent innovations having an impact on the consumer, which markets are ahead of the curve when it comes to adopting the latest real-time applications and how some of the latest innovations have tackled the issue of security, when leveraging the real-time rails.

item.title: When, if ever, will the Nordics become cashless?
item.description: Erik Zingmark, Head of Transaction Banking, Nordea, speaks at Sibos 2018 in Sydney, whether banks are really being disrupted by fintechs, what corporates are expecting from their banks in the next 3 to 5 years, and when, if ever, it will become cashless in the Nordics.

item.title: Bringing together the vision of connected commerce
item.description: Gerrard Schmid, President and Chief Executive Officer Diebold Nixdorf, speaks at Diebold Nixdorf's International Management Seminar in Lisbon, about how banks need to support their customers through multi-channels as a result of digitisation, what is driving mobile banking, where the potential is for retail banks, and whether cash is really becoming extinct.

item.title: The combined effect of Open Banking and Real-time Payments
item.description: Jerry Norton, Vice President and Global Head of Banking for CGI, talks about how the combined effect of Open Banking and real-time payments on banks and what they need to do to adapt to the changing landscape.

item.title: Digitalizing CLM for improved customer experience
item.description: Joe Dunphy, VP of Product Management, Fenergo, discusses what benefits digitalising the client lifecycle experience can bring financial institutions and their clients, how Fenergo’s CLM roadmap has evolved over the past two years to deliver greater transparency and control, and the importance of Fenergo’s global client community for driving industry best practice.

item.title: KYC, AML & Transparency for Crypto-Currencies & ICOs
item.description: Conor Coughlan, Global Head of Marketing, Fenergo, discusses the challenges facing institutions, issuers, exchanges, & investors in determining viability & suitability, for investing in crypto-currencies, ICOs and derived offerings so that this new asset class can mature, open up to institutional investors and play a more value adding role in the global economy.

item.title: The Future of Cryptocurrency and its Effect on Worldwide Commerce
item.description: Cryptocurrency’s resilience to market volatility remains strong. As the decentralised finance (De-Fi...

item.title: Urgently Resetting Banks' Growth Strategy in the Current Climate
item.description: The current banking climate is facing a lot of changes and challenges that banks need to address urg...

item.title: Optimising trade finance: shifting the sanctions-checking burden to technology could be the solution
item.description: Navigating complex, overlapping sanctions is placing renewed pressure on banks’ compliance operation...

item.title: Breaking Tradition: Why More SMBs are Saying Yes to New Currencies
item.description: As the business world continues to evolve, small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) are embracing ne...

item.title: SWIFT Alternatives and Crypto Remittance : Sending Money with Crypto
item.description: In recent years, blockchain and cryptocurrency have disrupted traditional financial systems and are ...
